description: Test Cases for use with Google ADK adk eval

parts.text:
For Lipitor 20mg, the cheapest therapeutically equivalent option is its generic, Atorvastatin Calcium.
 Here's a comparison of the average spend per dosage unit under Medicare Part D in 2023: Lipitor (brand): $15.68
 Atorvastatin Calcium (generic): As low as $0.11 (from Marlex Pharm.) This means the generic Atorvastatin Calcium
 can be significantly cheaper. Please remember that this is a program-level average and your individual co-pay may vary.

For Ritalin 10mg, here are the therapeutically equivalent options ranked by their average Medicare Part D spend per dosage unit in 2023:
 Ritalin (Brand-name): $1.28 per dose
 Methylphenidate (Generic from Mylan): $12.64 per dose
 Methylphenidate (Generic, overall average): $12.64 per dose
 Methylphenidate (Generic from Padagis): $12.65 per dose
 Daytrana (Brand-name Methylphenidate): $15.28 per dose
 Cotempla XR-ODT (Brand-name Methylphenidate): $16.89 per dose
 Based on the 2023 Medicare Part D data, the brand-name Ritalin 10mg tablet has the lowest average spend per dosage unit among the therapeutically equivalent options.
 Please remember that this metric reflects program-level average spend and may not directly equate to your individual co-pay.
